Section.name: S_17779
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note F)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50194
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_50194_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_54484
DisplayedItem.title: Iris melanomas originate from, and are predominantly located in, this region of the uvea. If less than half the tumor volume is located within the iris, the tumor may have originated in the ciliary body, and consideration should be given to classifying it accordingly.

ListItem.title: pT1d: Tumor size category 1 with ciliary body involvement and extraocular extension less than or equal to 5 mm in largest diameter

ListItem.name: LI_17171

DisplayedItem.name: DI_54218
DisplayedItem.title: Primary ciliary body and choroidal melanomas are classified according to the four tumor size categories defined in Figure 3 (CAP Cancer Protocol Explanatory Notes).

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41964
DisplayedItem.title: In clinical practice, the largest tumor basal diameter may be estimated in optic disc diameters (DD; average: 1 DD = 1.5 mm), and tumor thickness may be estimated in diopters (average: 2.5 diopters = 1 mm). Ultrasonography and fundus photography are used to provide more accurate measurements.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50620
DisplayedItem.title: When histopathologic measurements are recorded after fixation, tumor diameter and thickness may be underestimated because of tissue shrinkage.

ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

DisplayedItem.title: pN1: Regional lymph node metastasis or discrete tumor deposits in the orbit

ListItem.title: pN1a: Metastasis in one or more regional lymph node(s)

ListItem.name: LI_41122
ListItem.title: pN1b: No regional lymph nodes are positive, but there are discrete tumor deposits in the orbit that are not contiguous to the eye (choroidal and ciliary body)

ListItem.name: LI_14929
ListItem.title: Mitotic rate (number of mitoses per 40 fields determined by using a 40X objective with a field area of 0.152 mm2) (specify)

ListItem.name: LI_29449
ListItem.title: Vasculogenic mimicry patterns (extracellular closed loops and networks, the latter defined as at least 3 back-to-back closed loops, is associated with death from metastatic disease)

ListItem.name: LI_14920
ListItem.title: Vascular invasion (tumor vessels or other vessels)
